Chris Harley

Full Stack Developer | Creative Thinker

Hi, I'm a U.S. Army veteran turned software engineer based in Atlanta, Ga. I love developing full stack applications and learning new things.

- About Me

Hello, I'm Chris a fullstack developer based in Atlanta, GA.

I enjoy learning and creating things that live on the internet. My goal is to build applications that look amazing and help people fix real world problems that they're having. I enjoy expressing myself through creativity/art and I have a passion for problem solving. I'm a U.S. Army veteran who strides himself in being able to pick up on things quickly, change focus on the goal instantly as needed, work well with a team, and am culturally diverse.

Here are some technologies I've been working with lately:

  • - JavaScript (ES6+)
  • - React
  • - Node.js
  • - HTML & (S)CSS
  • - MongoDB
  • - postgreSQL

- Latest Projects

Featured Project

soundWav

This is a full stack application built in Node.js. This platform makes it convenient for recording studios and musicians. Instead of calling or going to the studio the musician can directly from a internet browser book studio time. This application lets the user pick a recording room, a date, and a time and book the session. The room availability is kept in a database and notifies the user if the room is not available. If it is it books the session with the studio and notifies the user that there session has been booked.
  • Express
  • EJS
  • postgreSQL
  • Node.js
  • SCSS

Featured Project

top3

This is a front end project built in vanilla JavaScript and uses third party API's such as Triposo and Google maps. Are you visiting a location that you have never been and would like to know some top things in that city or even a country. top3 does just that. Enter a location and this application will give you a list of the top three places to eat, hotels, tours, and sites. It also gives you a Google map displaying the requested location.
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript
  • triposo API
  • Google Maps API

Featured Project

sceneIt

This application is a personal database of movie posters that allows you to search any movie and save it to your watch list. You can then go to you watch list and checkout the movies that you've seen. This application uses the OMDb API and SCSS for styling.
  • HTML
  • SCSS
  • JavaScript
  • OMDb API
